title: Adopt TypeScript for New Projects
context: Team discussed the benefits of type safety and better IDE support. After reviewing alternatives, TypeScript was chosen as the default language for all new projects.
decision: All new projects will use TypeScript. Existing JavaScript projects will be migrated gradually.
rationale: TypeScript provides better type safety, improved developer experience, and catches errors at compile time.
consequences: Learning curve for team members new to TypeScript

title: Use Tailwind CSS for Styling
context: Need to standardize styling approach across projects. Evaluated several CSS frameworks and methodologies.
decision: Adopt Tailwind CSS as the primary styling solution.
rationale: Utility-first approach speeds up development, smaller bundle sizes with purging, excellent documentation and community support.

title: Implement Two-Week Sprint Cycles
context: Current sprint cycles are too long, leading to delayed feedback and course corrections.
decision: Move from three-week to two-week sprint cycles starting Q1 2025.
rationale: Shorter cycles allow for faster feedback, more frequent releases, and better adaptability to changing requirements.
